import.csv_wizard_description: Import data from a CSV file into the system

imports.choose_type_description: Select the type of data you want to import. You can import one type at a time.
imports.commit_import_description: Final review and confirm the import
imports.commit_import_description_detailed: Review all data before finalizing the import
imports.commit_warning: Once you commit the import, the data will be added to your system. This action cannot be undone automatically.
imports.description: Follow our step-by-step wizard to import customers, items, invoices, and more from CSV files. We'll guide you through the process.
imports.download_csv_templates_description: Download CSV template files for importing data
imports.drag_drop_files: Drag and drop your file here

field_descriptions.customer_email: Primary email address for invoices and communication
field_descriptions.customer_name: Full name of the customer or contact person
field_descriptions.customer_phone: Contact phone number including country code
field_descriptions.customer_vat_number: Tax identification or VAT registration number
field_descriptions.item_price: Price per unit (numbers only, no currency symbols)
field_descriptions.payment_amount: Amount paid (numbers only, no currency symbols)

imports.file_too_large: File is too large ({size}). Maximum allowed size is {maxSize}
imports.final_check_description: Everything is ready for import. Review the following items:
imports.format_help_content: We support CSV (.csv), Excel (.xls, .xlsx), and XML (.xml) files. For best results, use UTF-8 encoding.
imports.getting_started_description: Choose what type of data you want to import and we'll walk you through the process step by step.
imports.help_commit_step1: Review the summary of records to be imported
imports.help_commit_step2: Click 'Commit Import' to start the import process
imports.help_commit_step3: Wait for completion - don't close the browser window
imports.help_mapping_step2: Click on dropdown to change any incorrect mappings
imports.help_mapping_step3: Ensure all required fields are mapped (marked with red asterisk)
imports.help_upload_step1: Drag and drop your file into the upload area
imports.help_upload_step2: Or click the 'Browse Files' button to select a file
imports.help_upload_step3: Wait for the upload to complete (progress bar will show status)
imports.help_validation_step1: Click 'Validate' to check your data for errors
imports.help_validation_step2: Review any validation errors or warnings
imports.help_validation_step3: Fix errors in your source file and re-upload if needed
imports.map_fields_description: Connect fields from your file to the corresponding fields in the system
imports.map_fields_description_detailed: Match columns from your file to the corresponding fields in our system
imports.new_to_migration_tip: We highly recommend taking the interactive tour to learn all features
imports.override_type_help: Manually select the import type to override the automatic detection. Leave blank to use the detected type.
imports.pitfall_encoding: Special characters not displaying - ensure UTF-8 encoding
imports.pitfall_file_format: Wrong file format - use CSV, Excel, or XML only
imports.pitfall_file_size: Files larger than 50MB - split into smaller files
imports.prereq_data_file: Prepare your data file (CSV, Excel, or XML)
imports.prereq_data_file_hint: Export from your previous system or use our template
imports.prereq_format_hint: Check for special characters and encoding
imports.prereq_time: Set aside 5-10 minutes for the process
imports.quickstart_goal: Import Your Data in 4 Easy Steps
imports.quickstart_goal_description: Follow our guided wizard to migrate your data seamlessly
imports.ready_for_mapping: Ready to proceed to field mapping

step_1.description: Choose what you want to import
step_1.help: Start by selecting the type of data you want to import. Each type has its own template and required fields.
step_1.title: Step 1: Select Data Type

step_2.description: Get the CSV template for your data
step_2.encoding_info: Use UTF-8 encoding for special characters
step_2.help: Download our template file to see the correct format and required columns. Fill it with your data using Excel, Google Sheets, or any spreadsheet application.
step_2.sample_data_help: The template includes sample data to help you understand the format
step_2.tip_1: Open the template in Excel or Google Sheets
step_2.tip_2: Keep the header row - don't modify column names
step_2.tip_3: Fill in your data starting from row 2
step_2.title: Step 2: Download Template

step_3.description: Upload your CSV file with the data
step_3.drop_zone_subtitle: or click to browse your computer
step_3.help: Select the CSV file you've prepared with your data. We'll validate it and show you a preview before importing.
step_3.title: Step 3: Upload Your File
step_3.validation_error: We found some issues with your file
step_3.validation_success: File looks good! Ready to proceed.

step_4.auto_mapped_description: We automatically matched these fields based on column names
step_4.description: Match your columns to our fields
step_4.help: Connect the columns from your file to the corresponding fields in our system. We'll try to auto-match based on column names, but you can adjust as needed.
step_4.title: Step 4: Map Your Fields

step_5.help: Check the summary below and make sure everything looks correct. You can go back to any step if you need to make changes.
step_5.please_wait: Please wait while we import your data. This may take a few minutes.
step_5.ready_description: Click the button below to start importing your data
step_5.skip_duplicates_help: Skip rows that already exist in the system
step_5.title: Step 5: Review & Import
step_5.update_existing_help: If we find matching records, update them instead of creating duplicates

step_6.description: Your data has been imported successfully
step_6.next_step_1: Review the imported data in the system
step_6.next_step_2: Import another data type if needed
step_6.next_step_3: Start creating new invoices and estimates
step_6.success_message: We've successfully imported your data into the system.
step_6.title: Import Complete!

imports.subtitle: Easily migrate your data from other accounting systems
imports.template_download_failed: Failed to download template. Please try again.
imports.template_help_content: Download our pre-formatted templates to see exactly what format we expect. Fill in your data and upload it back.
imports.tip_backup_data: Always backup your existing data before importing
imports.tip_column_headers: Include column headers in the first row of your file
imports.tip_file_size: Keep file size under 50MB for optimal performance
imports.tip_macedonian_headers: You can use Macedonian or English column names
imports.tip_test_small_file: Test with a small file first (10-20 records) before importing everything
imports.tip_use_templates: Use our templates to avoid formatting errors
imports.tips_help_content: Follow these tips for a smooth import experience
imports.title: Import Your Data
imports.tour_autodetect_content: Click this button to automatically match your columns based on their names. It saves time!
imports.tour_commit_content: This is your final chance to review what will be imported. Check the summary carefully.
imports.tour_errors_action: Review errors and fix them in your file
imports.tour_errors_content: Click on any error to see details. You can download an error report to fix issues in your source file.
imports.tour_final_action: Click when you're ready to proceed
imports.tour_final_content: When you're ready, click this button to start the import. The process may take a few minutes depending on file size.
imports.tour_mapping_action: Select a different field from any dropdown
imports.tour_mapping_content: Connect columns from your file to fields in our system. We auto-detect most fields, but you can adjust them.
imports.tour_progress_content: The sidebar shows your current step and overall progress. You can jump between steps once they're unlocked.
imports.tour_template_action: Click any template button to download
imports.tour_template_content: Not sure about the format? Download our pre-formatted templates for customers, items, invoices, and more.
imports.tour_tips_content: These tips will help you avoid common mistakes and ensure a successful import.
imports.tour_upload_action: Try dragging a file or clicking to browse
imports.tour_upload_content: Drag and drop your CSV, Excel, or XML file here. We support files up to 50MB.
imports.tour_validation_content: See how many records passed validation and which ones have errors. All errors must be fixed before importing.
imports.tour_welcome_content: This guided tour will show you how to import your data in 4 simple steps. Let's get started!

type_descriptions.customers: Import your customer list with contact details, addresses, and billing information
type_descriptions.estimates: Import quotes and estimates you've created for customers
type_descriptions.expenses: Import business expenses and vendor bills
type_descriptions.invoices: Import existing invoices with line items, amounts, and customer references
type_descriptions.items: Import your products or services with prices, descriptions, and tax settings
type_descriptions.payments: Import payment records linked to invoices

imports.upload_file_description: Select a file to import from your computer

imports.upload_step_help_content: Drag and drop your CSV, Excel, or XML file here, or click to browse. Maximum file size is 50MB.

imports.validate_data_description_detailed: Review and fix any validation errors before proceeding

cta_footer.subtitle: Join thousands of businesses trusting Facturino.

faq.a1: Yes, we offer a 14-day free trial on all paid plans.
faq.a2: Absolutely. There are no long-term contracts and you can cancel whenever you like.
faq.a3: We use bank-level encryption to ensure your data is always safe and secure.
faq.a4: Yes, Facturino supports over 100 currencies with live exchange rates.

customization.customer_sequence_description: Consecutive sequence of numbers for each of your customer.
customization.customer_series_description: To set a different prefix/postfix for each customer.
customization.date_format_description: A local date and time field which accepts a format parameter. The default format: 'Y' renders the current year.

preferences.allow_negative_stock_description: Enable this to allow creating invoices even when there is insufficient stock. When disabled, invoices cannot be created if items exceed available stock.
preferences.discount_setting_description: Enable this if you want to add Discount to individual invoice items. By default, Discount is added directly to the invoice.
preferences.expire_setting_description: Specify whether you would like to expire all the links sent by application to view invoices, estimates & payments, etc after a specified duration.
preferences.ifrs_enabled_description: Enable double-entry accounting (IFRS) for this company. When enabled, all invoices, payments, and expenses will be posted to the general ledger. Note: The global accounting backbone feature must also be enabled.
preferences.invoice_use_time_description: Enable this if you want to select exact invoice time.
preferences.tax_setting_description: Configure how taxes are applied to invoices
preferences.title: Title

privacy_data.right_rectification: Right to Rectification - Request correction of inaccurate data

two_factor.disable_warning: Disabling two-factor authentication will make your account less secure. Are you sure you want to continue?
two_factor.disabled_description: Two-factor authentication is not enabled on your account.
two_factor.enabled_description: Two-factor authentication is currently enabled on your account.
two_factor.instruction_1: Download an authenticator app like Google Authenticator or Authy on your phone.
two_factor.instruction_2: Scan the QR code above with your authenticator app, or enter the secret key manually.
two_factor.instruction_3: Enter the 6-digit code from your authenticator app below to confirm setup.
two_factor.protected_description: Your account is protected with two-factor authentication. You will need to enter a code from your authenticator app each time you log in.
two_factor.recovery_code_description: Use a recovery code to access your account if you lose your authenticator device
two_factor.recovery_codes_description: Recovery codes can be used to access your account if you lose your authentication device
two_factor.recovery_codes_info: View or regenerate your recovery codes.
two_factor.recovery_codes_modal_desc: Store these codes in a safe place. Each code can only be used once.
two_factor.recovery_codes_warning: Save these recovery codes in a safe place. You can use them to access your account if you lose your authentication device.
two_factor.section_description: Add an extra layer of security to your account by enabling two-factor authentication.
two_factor.setup_intro: Two-factor authentication adds an extra layer of security to your account by requiring more than just a password to log in.
two_factor.title: Title
